name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: The women who are belittled. The women who are sure they can't be loved. The women who have silvery scars on their arms and their legs. The women want everyone to stop asking when they'll get married and have a baby. The women who rule at karaoke but are afraid to speak at home.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: The women who drink too much because life is so bloody hard. The women who wonder if they can ever just be women without a fight. The women who feel like their skin doesn't fit. The women who see women like me complaining and think, 'You have no fucking idea.'

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*

description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: The women carrying children out of war zones. The women too afraid to leave. The women who don't feel anything like the women they see on TV. The women who will never be called inspirational. The women who live with self loathing. The women who are hungry. Love you ü§ç

tweet: Here's to the women who live unglamorous lives; who spend their hours caring for others; who are sick and hurting, undervalued and invisible; who clean up after the women who are taking up platforms today; who are barely holding things together on minimum wage. I see you ü§ç

and each season follows the other in sequence.

The cold shrinks underground, the clouds draw up higher."

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
I always read A Nocturnal upon St Lucy's Day today because it is just dreary enough to help. Midwinter is rock bottom. We're now crawling towards the solstice. 

https://t.co/ofSLyvMie5

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
It's a beautiful, symbolic turn of the year - unable to percieve hope ourselves, we instead pass it on. For the martryed St Lucy, as for John Donne in the depths of mourning, as for the quiet forest at midwinter:

I am re-begot
Of absence, darkness, death: things which are not.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
But the very depths of winter suggest the return of the light - that's what St Lucy represents. 

Study me then, you who shall lovers be
At the next world, that is, at the next spring;
         For I am every dead thing,
         In whom Love wrought new alchemy.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
'Tis the year's midnight, and it is the day's,
Lucy's, who scarce seven hours herself unmasks...

Today is St Lucy's Day, traditionally the darkest day of the year. As John Donne's poem shows, a day of despair, hoplessness and grief: 

https://t.co/ofSLyvMie5

tweet: @HolSmale It's not the same as saying 'everyone's a bit autistic'. But everyone's brain has a point at which it can no longer process what's happening. We just fall down sooner because we're already overwhelmed.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: @HolSmale I don't think so - because to be autistic is to have a very specific set of needs that will always be there, regardless of how society presents itself. It's just that the way things are going, we're all feeling the adverse effects of a society that doesn't meet anyone's needs.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: I say this because one of the push-backs I often get when I talk about being autistic is 'Why do you get to demand care? I'm suffering too!' I think it's a cry from the heart. Honestly. We all need to be allowed to choose a more sustainable life.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: So anyway, isn't it time we started pushing back against it all? If everyone started saying 'this is not okay' rather than 'I'm clearly a defective human being who can't cope with basic living', we'd have something like a movement.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
I used to assume that extroverts were at least being served by this, but I'm not convinced that's the case. They're left in a state of constant yearning for human contact because we're so isolated. 

Nobody's mind or body is able to assimilate this.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: I think we often think it's just us - the we, or our social group - can't manage it. But honestly, who is getting their needs met? Who isn't being harmed?

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
It seems to me that we've created a society that's actively harming the majority of people who live in it (think of the tiny number of people who can possibly keep up with what we ought to be). 

It makes excessive demands on us, and takes away our ability to rest and process.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: ... the retreat in the media of any kind of vision of what it really means to be human - falilable, imperfect - replaced by a bombardment of 'perfect' bodies, and houses, and lives. Knowing they're not real, but not being able to let go of their demands ...

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: ... a demand for perpetual growth, for perpetual acquisition, for 'climbing the ranks' and 'working your way up the housing ladder', while actually we don't feel like we have basically secure housing and income. The retreat of a sense of safety, of purpose ...

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: ...an awareness of our need for care, without the ability to seek that care. Endless uncertainty. The retreat of silence, of solitude, of quiet. A loss of key rites of passage, and the ability to mark them - the experience of being 'ritual-poor'...

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: ...a level of perspective on the world's troubles that transcend our ability to process or act. High levels of conflict with those we love over ideology, with the corresponding social structures that knit us back together...

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: Features of a neuro-hostile society might include: long working hours, constant noise and light, 24/7 personal availability, an environment in which what seems to be the truth must always be questioned, and so requires exhausting eternal vigilance...

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: Maybe we're just the pit canaries for a society that's lost all ability to find equilibrium? Or maybe we care less about social convention and so are more willing to resist?

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: 3am thoughts - ND people find a lot of the way we live hostile to our good health, but a lot of neurotypical people seem to feel the same way. Have we created a world that's generally neuro-hostile?

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: 'We still perceive the presence of those we've lost in the silence of those long [winter] evenings, and in the depths of darkness they bring. This is the season of ghosts. Their pale forms are invisible in bright sunlight. Winter makes them clear again.'

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: In Wintering, I call this 'a liminal moment in the calendar: a time between two worlds'. On Halloween, we tread that liminality in a garish, ghoulish way. In the days that follow, we can pursue a different kind of liminality, one that feels like making contact with loss.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: What I love about the older traditions of tending to the dead (like the Christian All Saints' Day on 1st November and All Souls' Day on 2nd) is that they invite in the wider community of grievers, and not just the people whose loss is recent. We can manifest our loss again.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: Our ancestors would have seen the wild, table-turning chaos of Halloween as the beginning of a more contemplative turn in the year. The veil between the two worlds is still thin. Today is a good day to remember lost loved ones :)

I could say a lot more!

Later today, you can catch me online on @JenPastiloff‚Äôs Instagram (2pm PST) and at @SkylarkBookshop (6pm CST) - book here:

https://t.co/s61rZsx6nH

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
And when you do that, you open up space for other people to flow into. 

You let them say, ‚ÄòOh, so am I!‚Äô 

Or, ‚ÄòSo is my son!‚Äô

Or, ‚ÄòHm, maybe I am too?‚Äô 

You welcome us in. You knit us back into society. You probably learn something along the way.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
We are full of the fascinating knowledge and creativity that enriches the world we all share. Want to help?  Just state the fact and say no more.

‚ÄòShe‚Äôs autistic.‚Äô

It is not an insult. It is not something pitiable. It is not a secret.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: The truth is, there is no ‚Äòso‚Ä¶‚Äô after ‚Äòshe‚Äôs autistic.‚Äô (Let‚Äôs forget the ‚Äòopenly‚Äô because - ugh.) We are not a homogeneous mass. We are different enough that I - also ‚Äòopenly autistic‚Äô - can go undetected. It‚Äôs time to accept that you might have something to learn.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
‚ÄòBefore you say any more,‚Äô I said, ‚Äòyou need to know I‚Äôm autistic too.‚Äô

I do this now, rather than wait to let people put their foot in their mouth. What would she have said? Weird? Intense? Quirky? Who knows. Even as I said it, I felt that familiar sinking in the gut.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: Last week, I attended a course. Within five minutes of arriving, I started to talk to a woman there. She was warm and friendly, and we started to share our favourite podcasts. She‚Äôd been listening to a brilliant woman, she said, ‚Äòalthough she‚Äôs openly autistic, so‚Ä¶‚Äô

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
I wrote it because I found it so hard to find a mirror of myself, as an autistic woman who grew up not knowing what she was. It was an act of homecoming for me. 

I now find many more representations of myself in the media, bit I still think we‚Äôre poorly understood. A story‚Ä¶

tweet: I am personally convinced that mask-wearing significantly reduces covid transmission. I realise that others are not. I'm deeply comfortable with having opposing views in my feed. But when that crosses over into conspiracy theories and hate-speech, I block.

tweet: Let's be clear here: most of the stuff being shared comes from hardcore anti-vaxx sites. The anti-vaxx movement is founded on eradicating autism. Just because they don't understand how vaccines work, doesn't mean that their intentions are anything other than eugenic.

tweet: It's not a writing workshop (it's more of a thinking workshop) but do bring a notebook and you can write or draw or work in whatever way suits you. I can't wait!

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
We'll work through some gentle exercises to reflect on what needs to be put away from the last season, what needs to be kept and cherished, and what new things we need. 

We'll probably laugh and cry a bit too :)

2pm - 5pm UK / 9am - 12pm ET.

Book here:
https://t.co/WzUjFhz9u6

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
This Saturday I'm running an online workshop for fans of Wintering who'd like to work with me to get ready for winter. 

I've called it 'The Talvitelat', after the Finnish habit of putting away your summer clothes and getting out your winter ones. 

https://t.co/WzUjFhz9u6 https://t.co/ZGd1GtSUYo

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
I genuinely find it hard to picture. I've lived through a whole life where all the advice has pointed me towards breaking tasks down into small chunks, skipping between projects, doing little and often. 

It just doesn't work for me. I can't.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: @HolSmale Ugh yes. I feel like my brain is being squashed at the moment.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet:
Actually, I ground to a halt in the middle of that, too. 

I guess what I want to say is: imagine what it would be like to understand this through your whole life, and to be allowed to work with it.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: @HolSmale Right.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: So at the moment, I'm still primping my new book, and I'm completely obsessed with it. But I need to talk about my other books too. That's part of the job. Except they are now in the fog, which means that, every time I turn my attention towards them, I grind to a halt.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: Meanwhile, I experience immense clarity around the things I'm in love with, a sense of boundless energy and lightness. I forget everything else. I'm constantly craving that state of being, but I'm rarely allowed to enter it fully.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: It also brings about a pattern of failure in my life: I cannot pull my attention towards something that doesn't fascinate me at that point in time. That thing will be totally foggy to me, and if I try to focus on it too hard, my whole existence disappears into the fog.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: I don't really see that as a flaw. In fact, I think my ability to sink deep into one thing is pretty wonderful. But I often experience it as a kind of agony because I'm constantly being torn away from the way I want and need to work.

name: Katherine May
description: Brackish human ‚Ä¢ NYT bestselling author of Wintering & Electricity of Every Living Thing ‚Ä¢ The Wintering Sessions pod ‚Ä¢ #actuallyautistic she/her ‚Ä¢ *No DMs*
tweet: It's taken me decades to realise that I can only really do one thing at a time. It's a key feature of my neurodivergent brain, on a micro and macro level. In the moment can't multi-task, and more generally I can only work on one project at once.
